# setHiddenUntilMouseMoves(_:)

**Type Method**

Sets whether the cursor is hidden until the mouse moves.

## Declaration

```swift
class func setHiddenUntilMouseMoves(_ flag: Bool)
```

## Parameters

- **flag**: [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] to hide the cursor until one of the following occurs:

- The mouse moves.
- You invoke the method again, with `flag` set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

Do not try to counter this method by invoking [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCursor/unhide()]. The results are undefined.

## Setting cursor attributes

- **image**: The cursor’s image.
- **hotSpot**: The position of the click location within the cursor.
- **hide()**: Makes the current cursor invisible.
- **unhide()**: Negates an earlier call to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCursor/hide()] by showing the current cursor.
